title: Myriochelata
text:
The Myriochelata or Paradoxopoda, is a proposed grouping of <a href="arthropod">arthropod</a>s comprising the <a href="Myriapoda">Myriapoda</a> (including <a href="millipede">millipede</a>s and <a href="centipede">centipede</a>s) and <a href="Chelicerata">Chelicerata</a> (including <a href="spider">spider</a>s and <a href="scorpion">scorpion</a>s). If this proposition holds true, the Myriochelata are the sister <a href="clade">clade</a> to the <a href="Pancrustacea">Pancrustacea</a> (also "Tetraconata"), comprising classic <a href="crustacean">crustacean</a>s and <a href="hexapoda">hexapods</a>.
The evidence for this relationship between myriapods and chelicerates derives from comparisons of <a href="Cell%20nucleus">nuclear</a> <a href="ribosomal%20RNA">ribosomal RNA</a> <a href="gene">gene</a>s, <a href="mitochondria">mitochondria</a>l ribosomal RNA genes, and <a href="protein">protein</a>-coding genes. More recent molecular studies, however, favour grouping the myriapods with the Pancrustacea, rather than with the chelicerates, to make up the clade <a href="Mandibulata">Mandibulata</a>.
